page.title: 14Length of Day _ Mulben
page.content: Spring comes later to Mulben than to the South of England. Mulben is, of course, 500 miles further north. Crops are sown later in the North of Scotland, but are ready for harvesting almost as soon as crops in the South of England. There are more daylight hours here in Summer than in the South. On June 24th, we calculated the length of day in the North of Scotland and compared it with the number of hours of daylight in the South. In London, sunrise and sunset were at 04.44 hours and 21.22 hours, _ giving 16 hours, 38 minutes of daylight, while in the North of Scotland, we had 17 hours, 55 minutes of daylight. Sunrise and sunset were at 04.13 hours and 22.08 hours.
